pageContext.description: Typology; beading at either mouth variable rounded to flattened; beading round side opening flattened where broadens out at aither end; 2 bevelled surfaces on inside of loop - on one side much more steeply angled than other;, Manufacture: line of cg. flash visible inside loop - still a ridge towards ends, but seems worn in centre (perhaps by strap?), Condition: breaks at side and at mouth, both ancient - metal at latter very thin, Attached Material: pale fawn soil and chalky deposits embedded in corrosion.
pageContext.patina: small areas of greeny-gold to brown patina exposed
pageContext.surface: most covered with textured green surface including bluey-green spots
pageContext.collection: Collection destined for., Birchington, Quex Park Museum, Mr. D. Stead, Spratling Court Farm, Spratling Street, Ramsgate
pageContext.toSearch: Ozengell Place, Ramsgate, Kent Ct12 6ne, United Kingdom
pageContext.remarks: Context: 2a. Grave Group (o), PIF, AFI, PRBAF: Thanet Arch. Unit File, DF: S, SI, RSO 16/5/81, CI, Rec. SR Sept. 81, Source: Sb.A., Sub.Inf. Dave Perkins - Thanet Arch. Unit
